page.title: 16WIVELISCOMBE SCHOOL THEN
page.content: We asked Mr Burston (aged 72),an old pupil and ex-caretaker,about the changes he had seen in the school during his life. When he was at school,children walked or ran to school, there was no school transport. There were bells at nine o'clock and at quarter past. If pupils arrived after the second bell, they were caned. He remembers having the cane on many occasions! Once he was caught eating an apple (scrumped of course!) in class, and received three strokes on each hand. There were no school dinners, they were lucky if they had a piece of bread and dripping. All teaching was done from the blackboard, without many text books. Football was with a rag ball, and cricket played with a homemade bat.
